# Manifest Android Interview

> A comprehensive 465-page Android development guide featuring 108 interview questions with detailed solutions, 162 practical exercises, and 50+ pro tips.

## About This Book

Manifest Android Interview is the ultimate guide for Android developers preparing for technical interviews. Written by Jaewoong Eum (skydoves), a Google Developer Expert for Android and Firebase, this book covers:

- **108 Android & Jetpack Compose interview questions** with detailed solutions
- **162 hands-on exercise questions** for practice
- **50+ Pro Tips for Mastery** covering advanced patterns and internals

## Topics Covered

### Android Framework (33 Questions)
- Activity & Fragment lifecycle
- Intent, PendingIntent, BroadcastReceiver
- Service, ContentProvider
- Context types, Application class
- Memory management, ANR prevention
- Deep links, Tasks & Back stack
- Runtime permissions
- Looper, Handler, HandlerThread
- Build variants, R8 optimization
- ART, Dalvik, APK vs AAB

### Android UI - Views (16 Questions)
- View lifecycle, Custom views
- Canvas, invalidation
- RecyclerView internals
- SurfaceView vs TextureView
- Animations, Window
- Bitmap handling

### Jetpack Library (10 Questions)
- ViewModel, LiveData
- DataBinding, ViewBinding
- Navigation, Hilt/Dagger
- Paging, Baseline Profile

### Business Logic (8 Questions)
- Background tasks, WorkManager
- Network requests, JSON serialization
- Image loading, Local storage
- Offline-first patterns

### Jetpack Compose Fundamentals (11 Questions)
- Compose structure and phases
- Recomposition, Stability
- Composable function internals
- XML to Compose migration

### Compose Runtime (15 Questions)
- State management (remember, rememberSaveable)
- Side effects (LaunchedEffect, DisposableEffect)
- derivedStateOf, snapshotFlow
- CompositionLocal
- Snapshot system

### Compose UI (16 Questions)
- Modifier, Layout, Box
- Lazy lists, Pagination
- Canvas, graphicsLayer
- Navigation, Animations
- Testing, Accessibility

## Author

**Jaewoong Eum (skydoves)**
- Senior Developer Advocate & Engineer at RevenueCat
- Google Developer Expert for Android and Firebase
- Creator of 80+ open-source libraries (15M+ annual downloads)
- Founder of Dove Letter

"Manifest Android Interview stands as an essential guide for Android developers tackling theory-heavy technical interviews." - Manuel Vivo, Staff Android Engineer @ Bumble

"A must-have for anyone getting ready for an interview, or just wanting to brush up on their Android skills." - Simona Milanovic, Senior Android Developer Relations Engineer

"No matter your level of expertise, this book offers something for everyone." - Alejandra Stamato, Lead Android Engineer @ HubSpot
